item.title: Giant hogweed plant in flower, 30th July
item.description:
There is a single giant hogweed plant growing in the verge on the left hand side of the road if you’re heading towards Churchdown. We spotted it when out running along the road on 19th July but have only just remembered to report it. The plant is not the tallest I’ve ever seen, but it is definitely the giant hogweed variety as it has a huge thick stem and enormous flower umbels. It is growing towards the back of the verge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 30th July
item.description:
Customer reports that a tree opposite 60 Albert Road has a large dead branch hanging in the road, whilst another directly outside of 60 Albert Road has a dead branch which could potentially fall on the footway. Please can Highways remove these to make the trees safe.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive building works are being undertaken at a property 2 doors down from the church. The builders have cordoned off part of the on street parking for their vehicles. Other contractors mainly park in all the other onstreet parking. 1. One set of contractors 'Belt and Braces Roofing' are repeatedly parking vans on the opposite side of the road on single yellow lines and on the pavement. 2. This is a bus route and due to the narrowing of the road, there is congestion with all these vehicles. Impatient drivers are now mounting the pavement and driving down it to get through the road. The pavement is very well used by pedestrians so there is a risk of someone being hurt and this is a busy 'quiet' cycle route..., 30th July
item.description:
The property under development is 2 doors down from St Stephens Church (same side). There is herris fencing in front. The developer/builder is Brooks Pointin and this is displayed on the fence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Saint Stephen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Mature Horse Chestnut undermining perimeter wall, 30th July
item.description:
The tree in question is of significant age and size and appears to have an extensive root system that is now undermining my boundary walls, gates, and driveway. Over time, I’ve observed progressive damage including misalignment of gateposts, shifting ground levels, and repeated structural stress that requires ongoing maintenance and repair. Given its proximity to the house and the increasing disruption caused by root growth, I am concerned not only about further property damage but also potential safety risks if the structural integrity of walls or surfacing continues to degrade. I fully appreciate the environmental value of mature trees, However, in this case, I believe the tree’s location and scale may be incompatible with its current setting, and I would like to request that the council carry out a formal inspection and risk assessment. I would also be grateful if the council could consider contributing towards the cost of the ongoing maintenance works directly linked to the tree’s impact on my property. Please confirm receipt of this letter and advise on the next steps.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Kingsmead Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
